segments.text: What if I told you that cures for chronic disease were hidden in our own immune systems?
segments.textOneLine: What if I told you that cures for chronic disease were hidden in our own immune systems?

segments.text: If only we could read that information out.
segments.textOneLine: If only we could read that information out.

segments.text: So let's take multiple sclerosis, for example.
segments.textOneLine: So let's take multiple sclerosis, for example.

segments.text: Multiple sclerosis is a debilitating autoimmune disease where our own cells attack the brain.
segments.textOneLine: Multiple sclerosis is a debilitating autoimmune disease where our own cells attack the brain.

segments.text: And for years, we didn't know what caused it, which makes it very difficult to treat.
segments.textOneLine: And for years, we didn't know what caused it, which makes it very difficult to treat.

segments.text: So in January 2022, a study came out where they followed 10 million people for 20 years.
segments.textOneLine: So in January 2022, a study came out where they followed 10 million people for 20 years.

segments.text: And they found that Epstein-Barr virus, so mono, the kissing disease, increased the risk
segments.textOneLine: And they found that Epstein-Barr virus, so mono, the kissing disease, increased the risk

segments.text: of multiple sclerosis by 32 times.
segments.textOneLine: of multiple sclerosis by 32 times.

segments.text: It's a big deal.

segments.text: So the immune system stores an imprint of everything it encounters, infections, allergies,
segments.textOneLine: So the immune system stores an imprint of everything it encounters, infections, allergies,

segments.text: autoimmunity, toxins, cancer.
segments.textOneLine: autoimmunity, toxins, cancer.

segments.textOneLine: It's basically a web browser history.

segments.text: It's also how vaccines work.
segments.textOneLine: It's also how vaccines work.

segments.text: So though we may not know what is causing a disease, the immune system probably does.
segments.textOneLine: So though we may not know what is causing a disease, the immune system probably does.

segments.text: And if we could decode the immune archive at scale, we could apply forensic immunology
segments.textOneLine: And if we could decode the immune archive at scale, we could apply forensic immunology

segments.text: to diseases where we don't yet know the cause.
segments.textOneLine: to diseases where we don't yet know the cause.
